articles.author: BBC News
articles.description: The long-serving host leaves the BBC after apologising for sharing an antisemitic social media post.
articles.title: Gary Lineker signs off from final Match of the Day as he leaves BBC after 26 years

articles.author: BBC News
articles.description: In a rare rebuke, the US president says he is "not happy" with his Russian counterpart over the latest attacks.
articles.title: Trump calls Putin 'absolutely crazy' after largest Russian attack on Ukraine

articles.author: BBC News
articles.description: A new documentary follows the bra firm founder's journey from poverty to fame, fortune and controversy.
articles.title: The rise and fall of Michelle Mone: A self-created fairy story

articles.description: A mix of stories lead the front pages this Bank Holiday Monday, including the government's welfare cuts.
articles.title: Newspaper headlines: Winter fuel 'in total chaos', and Ukraine 'fury' at US

articles.author: BBC News
articles.description: The company building the high-speed rail line says it takes all whistleblower allegations seriously.
articles.title: HS2 investigating two firms supplying staff for West Midlands leg

articles.description: Disney's Lilo and Stitch remake and the latest Mission: Impossible become two of the year's biggest films.
articles.title: Lilo and Stitch beat Tom Cruise's Mission: Impossible – The Final Reckoning at box office

articles.description: The Workers' Party official was "largely responsible" for the botched launch, state media said.
articles.title: North Korea arrests senior official over warship launch failure

articles.author: BBC News
articles.description: Tom Hayes and Carlo Palombo were among 37 City traders prosecuted for "manipulating" interest rate benchmarks.

articles.author: BBC News
articles.description: The names of a woman and her three children who died following a house fire in north-west London have been released.
articles.title: Brent fire: Names of four people who died released by police

articles.author: BBC News
articles.description: Malnourished five-month-old baby Siwar is now out of hospital in Gaza - but as we found, she and her family are struggling.
articles.title: BBC returns to Gaza baby left hungry by Israeli blockade
